top_priorities.title: semgrep-rules.python-sql-injection-format
top_priorities.description: SQL injection: avoid string formatting/concatenation, use parameterized queries

remediation.guidance:
SQL Injection Remediation:
1. Use parameterized queries (prepared statements) instead of string concatenation
2. Use ORM frameworks with built-in protection
3. Implement input validation and sanitization
4. Apply principle of least privilege for database accounts
5. Use stored procedures with parameterized inputs
remediation.code_example:
# Vulnerable code:
query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {user_id}"
cursor.execute(query)

# Secure code:
query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?"
cursor.execute(query, (user_id,))

top_priorities.title: semgrep-rules.python-hardcoded-password
top_priorities.description: Hardcoded credential/secret detected

remediation.guidance:
Hardcoded Credentials Remediation:
1. Move secrets to environment variables
2. Use secret management systems (AWS Secrets Manager, HashiCorp Vault)
3. Implement proper key rotation
4. Never commit secrets to version control
5. Use .gitignore for sensitive configuration files
remediation.code_example:
# Vulnerable code:
API_KEY = "sk_live_1234567890abcdef"

# Secure code:
import os
API_KEY = os.environ.get("API_KEY")

top_priorities.title: semgrep-rules.python-pickle-unsafe
top_priorities.description: Insecure deserialization: pickle can execute arbitrary code

remediation.guidance:
Insecure Deserialization Remediation:
1. Avoid deserializing untrusted data
2. Use safe serialization formats (JSON instead of pickle)
3. Implement integrity checks (HMAC signatures)
4. Use allowlists for deserializable classes
5. Run deserialization in sandboxed environments
remediation.code_example:
# Vulnerable code:
import pickle
data = pickle.loads(user_input)

# Secure code:
import json
data = json.loads(user_input)

top_priorities.title: semgrep-rules.python-flask-render-template-string
top_priorities.description: XSS: render_template_string with non-constant template

remediation.guidance:
Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Remediation:
1. Enable auto-escaping in template engines
2. Use Content Security Policy (CSP) headers
3. Sanitize user input before rendering
4. Use framework-provided escaping functions
5. Validate and encode output based on context (HTML, JavaScript, URL)

top_priorities.title: semgrep-rules.python-flask-render-template-string

top_priorities.title: python.flask.security.injection.tainted-sql-string.tainted-sql-string
top_priorities.description: Detected user input used to manually construct a SQL string. This is usually bad practice because manual construction could accidentally result in a SQL injection. An attacker could use a SQL injection to steal or modify contents of the database. Instead, use a parameterized query which is available by default in most database engines. Alternatively, consider using an object-relational mapper (ORM) such as SQLAlchemy which will protect your queries.
cwe: CWE-704: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.injection.tainted-sql-string.tainted-sql-string. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.flask.security.dangerous-template-string.dangerous-template-string
top_priorities.description: Found a template created with string formatting. This is susceptible to server-side template injection and cross-site scripting attacks.
cwe: CWE-96: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Statically Saved Code ('Static Code Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.dangerous-template-string.dangerous-template-string. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.flask.security.injection.subprocess-injection.subprocess-injection
top_priorities.description: Detected user input entering a `subprocess` call unsafely. This could result in a command injection vulnerability. An attacker could use this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the host, which allows them to download malware, scan sensitive data, or run any command they wish on the server. Do not let users choose the command to run. In general, prefer to use Python API versions of system commands. If you must use subprocess, use a dictionary to allowlist a set of commands.
cwe: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.injection.subprocess-injection.subprocess-injection. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.lang.security.dangerous-subprocess-use.dangerous-subprocess-use
top_priorities.description: Detected subprocess function 'check_output' with user controlled data. A malicious actor could leverage this to perform command injection. You may consider using 'shlex.escape()'.
cwe: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.lang.security.dangerous-subprocess-use.dangerous-subprocess-use. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.lang.security.audit.subprocess-shell-true.subprocess-shell-true
top_priorities.description: Found 'subprocess' function 'check_output' with 'shell=True'. This is dangerous because this call will spawn the command using a shell process. Doing so propagates current shell settings and variables, which makes it much easier for a malicious actor to execute commands. Use 'shell=False' instead.
cwe: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.lang.security.audit.subprocess-shell-true.subprocess-shell-true. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.flask.security.dangerous-template-string.dangerous-template-string
top_priorities.description: Found a template created with string formatting. This is susceptible to server-side template injection and cross-site scripting attacks.
cwe: CWE-96: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Statically Saved Code ('Static Code Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.dangerous-template-string.dangerous-template-string. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.flask.security.injection.tainted-sql-string.tainted-sql-string
top_priorities.description: Detected user input used to manually construct a SQL string. This is usually bad practice because manual construction could accidentally result in a SQL injection. An attacker could use a SQL injection to steal or modify contents of the database. Instead, use a parameterized query which is available by default in most database engines. Alternatively, consider using an object-relational mapper (ORM) such as SQLAlchemy which will protect your queries.
cwe: CWE-704: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.injection.tainted-sql-string.tainted-sql-string. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.flask.security.insecure-deserialization.insecure-deserialization
top_priorities.description: Detected the use of an insecure deserialization library in a Flask route. These libraries are prone to code execution vulnerabilities. Ensure user data does not enter this function. To fix this, try to avoid serializing whole objects. Consider instead using a serializer such as JSON.
cwe: CWE-502: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
owasp: A08:2021 - Software and Data Integrity Failures

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.insecure-deserialization.insecure-deserialization. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.django.security.injection.ssrf.ssrf-injection-requests.ssrf-injection-requests
top_priorities.description: Data from request object is passed to a new server-side request. This could lead to a server-side request forgery (SSRF). To mitigate, ensure that schemes and hosts are validated against an allowlist, do not forward the response to the user, and ensure proper authentication and transport-layer security in the proxied request. See https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Server_Side_Request_Forgery to learn more about SSRF vulnerabilities.
cwe: CWE-918: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.django.security.injection.ssrf.ssrf-injection-requests.ssrf-injection-requests. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.flask.security.injection.ssrf-requests.ssrf-requests

To mitigate, ensure that schemes and hosts are validated against an allowlist, do not forward the response to the user, and ensure proper authentication and transport-layer security in the proxied request.
cwe: CWE-918: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.injection.ssrf-requests.ssrf-requests. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: python.requests.security.disabled-cert-validation.disabled-cert-validation
top_priorities.description: Certificate verification has been explicitly disabled. This permits insecure connections to insecure servers. Re-enable certification validation.
cwe: CWE-295: Improper Certificate Validation

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.requests.security.disabled-cert-validation.disabled-cert-validation. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

top_priorities.title: semgrep-rules.python-path-traversal
top_priorities.description: Path traversal risk: validate and normalize user-controlled file paths

remediation.guidance:
Path Traversal Remediation:
1. Validate and sanitize file paths
2. Use allowlists for permitted files/directories
3. Use os.path.basename() to strip directory components
4. Implement chroot jails or similar containment
5. Avoid direct file system access when possible
remediation.code_example:
# Vulnerable code:
with open(f"/uploads/{user_file}") as f:
    content = f.read()

# Secure code:
import os
safe_path = os.path.join("/uploads", os.path.basename(user_file))
if not safe_path.startswith("/uploads/"):
    raise ValueError("Invalid path")
with open(safe_path) as f:
    content = f.read()

all_findings.title: semgrep-rules.python-weak-hash-function
all_findings.description: Weak hash (MD5/SHA1) - use SHA-256 or a password hashing function (bcrypt, Argon2)

remediation.guidance:
Weak Cryptography Remediation:
1. Use SHA-256 or better instead of MD5/SHA-1
2. Use bcrypt, scrypt, or Argon2 for password hashing
3. Use AES-256 for encryption
4. Implement proper key management
5. Use TLS 1.2+ for data in transit
remediation.code_example:
# Vulnerable code:
import hashlib
hash = hashlib.md5(password.encode()).hexdigest()

# Secure code:
import bcrypt
hash = bcrypt.hashpw(password.encode(), bcrypt.gensalt())

2. Use ORM frameworks with built-in protection
3. Implement input validation and sanitization
4. Apply principle of least privilege for database accounts
5. Use stored procedures with parameterized inputs
remediation.code_example:
# Vulnerable code:
query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {user_id}"
cursor.execute(query)

# Secure code:
query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?"
cursor.execute(query, (user_id,))

all_findings.title: semgrep-rules.python-ssrf-requests
all_findings.description: SSRF: validate, normalize, and whitelist URLs before outbound requests

remediation.guidance:
SSRF Remediation:
1. Validate and whitelist allowed URLs/domains
2. Disable redirects in HTTP clients
3. Use network segmentation to limit internal access
4. Implement URL parsing and validation
5. Block requests to private IP ranges
remediation.code_example:
# Vulnerable code:
response = requests.get(user_url)

# Secure code:
from urllib.parse import urlparse
allowed_domains = ['api.example.com']
parsed = urlparse(user_url)
if parsed.netloc not in allowed_domains:
    raise ValueError("Invalid domain")
response = requests.get(user_url, allow_redirects=False)

# Secure code:

hash = bcrypt.hashpw(password.encode(), bcrypt.gensalt())

all_findings.title: python.django.security.injection.sql.sql-injection-using-db-cursor-execute.sql-injection-db-cursor-execute
all_findings.description: User-controlled data from a request is passed to 'execute()'. This could lead to a SQL injection and therefore protected information could be leaked. Instead, use django's QuerySets, which are built with query parameterization and therefore not vulnerable to sql injection. For example, you could use `Entry.objects.filter(date=2006)`.
cwe: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.django.security.injection.sql.sql-injection-using-db-cursor-execute.sql-injection-db-cursor-execute. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.django.security.injection.sql.sql-injection-using-db-cursor-execute.sql-injection-db-cursor-execute
all_findings.description: User-controlled data from a request is passed to 'execute()'. This could lead to a SQL injection and therefore protected information could be leaked. Instead, use django's QuerySets, which are built with query parameterization and therefore not vulnerable to sql injection. For example, you could use `Entry.objects.filter(date=2006)`.
cwe: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.django.security.injection.sql.sql-injection-using-db-cursor-execute.sql-injection-db-cursor-execute. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.flask.security.injection.tainted-sql-string.tainted-sql-string
all_findings.description: Detected user input used to manually construct a SQL string. This is usually bad practice because manual construction could accidentally result in a SQL injection. An attacker could use a SQL injection to steal or modify contents of the database. Instead, use a parameterized query which is available by default in most database engines. Alternatively, consider using an object-relational mapper (ORM) such as SQLAlchemy which will protect your queries.
cwe: CWE-704: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.injection.tainted-sql-string.tainted-sql-string. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.flask.security.audit.render-template-string.render-template-string
all_findings.description: Found a template created with string formatting. This is susceptible to server-side template injection and cross-site scripting attacks.
cwe: CWE-96: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Statically Saved Code ('Static Code Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.audit.render-template-string.render-template-string. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.flask.security.dangerous-template-string.dangerous-template-string
all_findings.description: Found a template created with string formatting. This is susceptible to server-side template injection and cross-site scripting attacks.
cwe: CWE-96: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Statically Saved Code ('Static Code Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.dangerous-template-string.dangerous-template-string. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.django.security.injection.raw-html-format.raw-html-format
all_findings.description: Detected user input flowing into a manually constructed HTML string. You may be accidentally bypassing secure methods of rendering HTML by manually constructing HTML and this could create a cross-site scripting vulnerability, which could let attackers steal sensitive user data. To be sure this is safe, check that the HTML is rendered safely. Otherwise, use templates (`django.shortcuts.render`) which will safely render HTML instead.
cwe: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.django.security.injection.raw-html-format.raw-html-format. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.flask.security.injection.raw-html-concat.raw-html-format
all_findings.description: Detected user input flowing into a manually constructed HTML string. You may be accidentally bypassing secure methods of rendering HTML by manually constructing HTML and this could create a cross-site scripting vulnerability, which could let attackers steal sensitive user data. To be sure this is safe, check that the HTML is rendered safely. Otherwise, use templates (`flask.render_template`) which will safely render HTML instead.
cwe: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.injection.raw-html-concat.raw-html-format. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.flask.security.injection.subprocess-injection.subprocess-injection
all_findings.description: Detected user input entering a `subprocess` call unsafely. This could result in a command injection vulnerability. An attacker could use this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the host, which allows them to download malware, scan sensitive data, or run any command they wish on the server. Do not let users choose the command to run. In general, prefer to use Python API versions of system commands. If you must use subprocess, use a dictionary to allowlist a set of commands.
cwe: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.injection.subprocess-injection.subprocess-injection. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.lang.security.dangerous-subprocess-use.dangerous-subprocess-use
all_findings.description: Detected subprocess function 'check_output' with user controlled data. A malicious actor could leverage this to perform command injection. You may consider using 'shlex.escape()'.
cwe: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.lang.security.dangerous-subprocess-use.dangerous-subprocess-use. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.lang.security.audit.subprocess-shell-true.subprocess-shell-true
all_findings.description: Found 'subprocess' function 'check_output' with 'shell=True'. This is dangerous because this call will spawn the command using a shell process. Doing so propagates current shell settings and variables, which makes it much easier for a malicious actor to execute commands. Use 'shell=False' instead.
cwe: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.lang.security.audit.subprocess-shell-true.subprocess-shell-true. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.django.security.injection.path-traversal.path-traversal-open.path-traversal-open
all_findings.description: Found request data in a call to 'open'. Ensure the request data is validated or sanitized, otherwise it could result in path traversal attacks and therefore sensitive data being leaked. To mitigate, consider using os.path.abspath or os.path.realpath or the pathlib library.
cwe: CWE-22: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.django.security.injection.path-traversal.path-traversal-open.path-traversal-open. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.django.security.injection.request-data-write.request-data-write
all_findings.description: Found user-controlled request data passed into '.write(...)'. This could be dangerous if a malicious actor is able to control data into sensitive files. For example, a malicious actor could force rolling of critical log files, or cause a denial-of-service by using up available disk space. Instead, ensure that request data is properly escaped or sanitized.
cwe: CWE-93: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences ('CRLF Injection')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.django.security.injection.request-data-write.request-data-write. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.flask.security.audit.directly-returned-format-string.directly-returned-format-string
all_findings.description: Detected Flask route directly returning a formatted string. This is subject to cross-site scripting if user input can reach the string. Consider using the template engine instead and rendering pages with 'render_template()'.
cwe: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.audit.directly-returned-format-string.directly-returned-format-string. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.lang.security.insecure-hash-algorithms-md5.insecure-hash-algorithm-md5
all_findings.description: Detected MD5 hash algorithm which is considered insecure. MD5 is not collision resistant and is therefore not suitable as a cryptographic signature. Use SHA256 or SHA3 instead.
cwe: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.lang.security.insecure-hash-algorithms-md5.insecure-hash-algorithm-md5. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.lang.security.audit.md5-used-as-password.md5-used-as-password
all_findings.description: It looks like MD5 is used as a password hash. MD5 is not considered a secure password hash because it can be cracked by an attacker in a short amount of time. Use a suitable password hashing function such as scrypt. You can use `hashlib.scrypt`.
cwe: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.lang.security.audit.md5-used-as-password.md5-used-as-password. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.flask.security.insecure-deserialization.insecure-deserialization
all_findings.description: Detected the use of an insecure deserialization library in a Flask route. These libraries are prone to code execution vulnerabilities. Ensure user data does not enter this function. To fix this, try to avoid serializing whole objects. Consider instead using a serializer such as JSON.
cwe: CWE-502: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
owasp: A08:2021 - Software and Data Integrity Failures

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.insecure-deserialization.insecure-deserialization. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.lang.security.deserialization.pickle.avoid-pickle
all_findings.description: Avoid using `pickle`, which is known to lead to code execution vulnerabilities. When unpickling, the serialized data could be manipulated to run arbitrary code. Instead, consider serializing the relevant data as JSON or a similar text-based serialization format.
cwe: CWE-502: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
owasp: A08:2021 - Software and Data Integrity Failures

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this MEDIUM severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.lang.security.deserialization.pickle.avoid-pickle. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.django.security.injection.ssrf.ssrf-injection-requests.ssrf-injection-requests
all_findings.description: Data from request object is passed to a new server-side request. This could lead to a server-side request forgery (SSRF). To mitigate, ensure that schemes and hosts are validated against an allowlist, do not forward the response to the user, and ensure proper authentication and transport-layer security in the proxied request. See https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Server_Side_Request_Forgery to learn more about SSRF vulnerabilities.
cwe: CWE-918: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.django.security.injection.ssrf.ssrf-injection-requests.ssrf-injection-requests. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.description: Data from request object is passed to a new server-side request. This could lead to a server-side request forgery (SSRF). To mitigate, ensure that schemes and hosts are validated against an allowlist, do not forward the response to the user, and ensure proper authentication and transport-layer security in the proxied request.
cwe: CWE-918: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.flask.security.injection.ssrf-requests.ssrf-requests. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.requests.security.disabled-cert-validation.disabled-cert-validation
all_findings.description: Certificate verification has been explicitly disabled. This permits insecure connections to insecure servers. Re-enable certification validation.
cwe: CWE-295: Improper Certificate Validation

remediation.guidance: Review and remediate this HIGH severity vulnerability. Consult security best practices and OWASP guidelines for python.requests.security.disabled-cert-validation.disabled-cert-validation. Consider the business impact and prioritize accordingly.

all_findings.title: python.flask.security.audit.debug-enabled.debug-enabled

cwe: CWE-489: Active Debug Code
